member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.CreateDrawingSession(Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Returns a new drawing session for redrawing the entire image source.
member.remarks: The entire image is automatically cleared to the specified color before this method returns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.CreateDrawingSession(Windows.UI.Color,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Returns a new drawing session for updating a region of the image source.
member.remarks: The specified region of the image is cleared to the specified color before this method returns. The region is in device independent pixels (dips).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.Device
member.summary: Gets or sets the device used by this image source.
member.remarks: Changing this property binds the image source to a different device. This is used after a new device is recovered after a device lost.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.Dpi
member.summary: Gets the dots-per-inch (DPI) of this image source.
member.remarks: DPI describes the ratio between device independent pixels (dips) and actual physical pixels. The identity DPI value is 96, which means dips and pixels are the same.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.ConvertPixelsToDips(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts units from physical pixels to device independent pixels (dips) based on the DPI of this image source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageSource.ConvertDipsToPixels(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts units from device independent pixels (dips) to physical pixels based on the DPI of this image source.
